â€” Window Size Impact in Human Activity Recognition , 2014.
Nevertheless, it is common to use one to two seconds of sensor data in order to classify a
current fragment of an activity.
From the results, reduced windows (2 s or less) are demonstrated to provide the most
accurate detection performance. In fact, the most precise recognizer is obtained for
very short windows (0.25-0.5 s), leading to the perfect recognition of most activities.
